DataElement.preferredName: Gestational Trophoblastic Tumor American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) Edition 7 Group Stage
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Stage group determined from information on the tumor (T) and metastases (M) and by grouping cases with similar prognosis for gestational trophoblastic tumor.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A diverse group of lesions characterized by excessive proliferation of trophoblasts.  These include premalignant lesions: hydatidiform mole (complete and partial) and malignant disorders: invasive mole, choriocarcinoma, placental site trophoblastic tumor and miscellaneous trophoblastic lesions.  These tumors are very chemosensitive.  All produce Human Chorionic Gonadotrophin which is utilized as a tumor marker. - 2003_An assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A group of interrelated trophoblastic diseases arising from pregnancy. They are commonly associated with hyperplasia of trophoblasts (TROPHOBLAST) and markedly elevated human CHORIONIC GONADOTROPIN. They include HYDATIDIFORM MOLE, invasive mole (HYDATIDIFORM MOLE, INVASIVE), placental-site trophoblastic tumor (TROPHOBLASTIC TUMOR, PLACENTAL SITE), and CHORIOCARCINOMA. These neoplasms have varying propensities for invasion and spread.

Concepts.definition: A diverse group of pregnancy-related tumors characterized by excessive proliferation of trophoblasts. It includes gestational choriocarcinoma, epithelioid trophoblastic tumor, placental site trophoblastic tumor, and mixed trophoblastic tumor.

Property.preferredDefinition: Stage Grouping; an assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage. (caDSR)

Concepts.definition: An assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage, as well as prognostic parameters for specific cancers.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for CRF standard harmonization. Released per final community approval. mc 5/7/12

ValueDomain.preferredName: Gestational Trophoblastic Tumor American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) Edition 7 Group Stage
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A diverse group of lesions characterized by excessive proliferation of trophoblasts.  These include premalignant lesions: hydatidiform mole (complete and partial) and malignant disorders: invasive mole, choriocarcinoma, placental site trophoblastic tumor and miscellaneous trophoblastic lesions.  These tumors are very chemosensitive.  All produce Human Chorionic Gonadotrophin which is utilized as a tumor marker. - 2003_A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications._An assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage._The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A finding indicating that the extent of organ/tissue involvement by a malignant neoplasm is not reported or not assessed.

Concepts.definition: The extent of organ/tissue involvement by a malignant neoplasm is not reported or not assessed.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage I includes: (T1, M0, Risk factors: unknown); IA (T1, M0, Risk factors: low risk); IB (T1, M0, Risk factors: high risk).  T1: Tumor confined to uterus.  M0: No distant metastasis.  (AJCC 7th ed.)

Concepts.longName: Stage I Gestational Trophoblastic Tumor AJCC v7
Concepts.definition: Stage I includes: (T1, M0, Risk factors: unknown); IA (T1, M0, Risk factors: low risk); IB (T1, M0, Risk factors: high risk).  T1: Tumor confined to uterus.  M0: No distant metastasis.  (AJCC 7th ed.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IA includes: T1, M0, Risk factors: low risk.  T1: Tumor confined to uterus.  M0: No distant metastasis.  (AJCC 7th ed.)

Concepts.longName: Stage IA Gestational Trophoblastic Tumor AJCC v7
Concepts.definition: Stage IA includes: T1, M0, Risk factors: low risk.  T1: Tumor confined to uterus.  M0: No distant metastasis.  (AJCC 7th ed.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IB includes: T1, M0, Risk factors: high risk.  T1: Tumor confined to uterus.  M0: No distant metastasis.  (AJCC 7th ed.)

Concepts.longName: Stage IB Gestational Trophoblastic Tumor AJCC v7
Concepts.definition: Stage IB includes: T1, M0, Risk factors: high risk.  T1: Tumor confined to uterus.  M0: No distant metastasis.  (AJCC 7th ed.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage II includes: (T2, M0, Risk factors: unknown); IIA (T2, M0, Risk factors: low risk); IIB (T2, M0, Risk factors: high risk).  T2: Tumor extends to other genital structures (ovary, tube, vagina, broad ligaments) by metastasis or direct extension.  M0: No distant metastasis.  (AJCC 7th ed.)

Concepts.longName: Stage II Gestational Trophoblastic Tumor AJCC v7
Concepts.definition: Stage II includes: (T2, M0, Risk factors: unknown); IIA (T2, M0, Risk factors: low risk); IIB (T2, M0, Risk factors: high risk).  T2: Tumor extends to other genital structures (ovary, tube, vagina, broad ligaments) by metastasis or direct extension.  M0: No distant metastasis.  (AJCC 7th ed.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IIA includes: T2, M0, Risk factors: low risk.  T2: Tumor extends to other genital structures (ovary, tube, vagina, broad ligaments) by metastasis or direct extension.  M0: No distant metastasis.  (AJCC 7th ed.)

Concepts.longName: Stage IIA Gestational Trophoblastic Tumor AJCC v7
Concepts.definition: Stage IIA includes: T2, M0, Risk factors: low risk.  T2: Tumor extends to other genital structures (ovary, tube, vagina, broad ligaments) by metastasis or direct extension.  M0: No distant metastasis.  (AJCC 7th ed.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IIB includes: T2, M0, Risk factors: high risk.  T2: Tumor extends to other genital structures (ovary, tube, vagina, broad ligaments) by metastasis or direct extension.  M0: No distant metastasis.  (AJCC 7th ed.)

Concepts.longName: Stage IIB Gestational Trophoblastic Tumor AJCC v7
Concepts.definition: Stage IIB includes: T2, M0, Risk factors: high risk.  T2: Tumor extends to other genital structures (ovary, tube, vagina, broad ligaments) by metastasis or direct extension.  M0: No distant metastasis.  (AJCC 7th ed.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage III includes: (Any T, M1a, Risk factors: unknown); IIIA (Any T, M1a, Risk factors: low risk); IIIB (Any T, M1a, Risk factors: high risk).  M1a: Lung metastasis.  (AJCC 7th ed.)

Concepts.longName: Stage III Gestational Trophoblastic Tumor AJCC v7
Concepts.definition: Stage III includes: (Any T, M1a, Risk factors: unknown); IIIA (Any T, M1a, Risk factors: low risk); IIIB (Any T, M1a, Risk factors: high risk).  M1a: Lung metastasis.  (AJCC 7th ed.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IIIA includes: Any T, M1a, Risk factors: low risk.  M1a: Lung metastasis.  (AJCC 7th ed.)

Concepts.longName: Stage IIIA Gestational Trophoblastic Tumor AJCC v7
Concepts.definition: Stage IIIA includes: Any T, M1a, Risk factors: low risk.  M1a: Lung metastasis.  (AJCC 7th ed.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IIIB includes: Any T, M1a, Risk factors: high risk.  M1a: Lung metastasis.  (AJCC 7th ed.)

Concepts.longName: Stage IIIB Gestational Trophoblastic Tumor AJCC v7
Concepts.definition: Stage IIIB includes: Any T, M1a, Risk factors: high risk.  M1a: Lung metastasis.  (AJCC 7th ed.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IV includes: (Any T, M1b, Risk factors: unknown); IVA (Any T, M1b, Risk factors: low risk); IVB (Any T, M1b, Risk factors: high risk).  M1b: All other distant metastasis.  (AJCC 7th ed.)

Concepts.longName: Stage IV Gestational Trophoblastic Tumor AJCC v7
Concepts.definition: Stage IV includes: (Any T, M1b, Risk factors: unknown); IVA (Any T, M1b, Risk factors: low risk); IVB (Any T, M1b, Risk factors: high risk).  M1b: All other distant metastasis.  (AJCC 7th ed.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IVA includes: Any T, M1b, Risk factors: low risk.  M1b: All other distant metastasis.  (AJCC 7th ed.)

Concepts.longName: Stage IVA Gestational Trophoblastic Tumor AJCC v7
Concepts.definition: Stage IVA includes: Any T, M1b, Risk factors: low risk.  M1b: All other distant metastasis.  (AJCC 7th ed.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IVB includes: Any T, M1b, Risk factors: high risk.  M1b: All other distant metastasis.  (AJCC 7th ed.)

Concepts.definition: Stage IVB includes: Any T, M1b, Risk factors: high risk.  M1b: All other distant metastasis.  (AJCC 7th ed.)

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Gestational Trophoblastic Tumor American Joint Committee on Cancer Stage Grouping Stage
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A group of interrelated trophoblastic diseases arising from pregnancy. They are commonly associated with hyperplasia of trophoblasts (TROPHOBLAST) and markedly elevated human CHORIONIC GONADOTROPIN. They include HYDATIDIFORM MOLE, invasive mole (HYDATIDIFORM MOLE, INVASIVE), placental-site trophoblastic tumor (TROPHOBLASTIC TUMOR, PLACENTAL SITE), and CHORIOCARCINOMA. These neoplasms have varying propensities for invasion and spread.:A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications.:An assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage.:The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

Concepts.definition: A diverse group of pregnancy-related tumors characterized by excessive proliferation of trophoblasts. It includes gestational choriocarcinoma, epithelioid trophoblastic tumor, placental site trophoblastic tumor, and mixed trophoblastic tumor.
A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications.
An assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage, as well as prognostic parameters for specific cancers.
The extent of a cancer in the body.
